body:
Hello. In Fedora, we try to build our packages with pre-releases of Python 3.9. Cython seem to work fine in general cases, but there are some test failures with Cython 0.29.15 and Python 3.9.0a3.

I haven't found any issue for this, so I'm opening this one to track it. I know that sometimes the master branch has such problems fixed and if pointed to them, we can work on backports.

Here is the full log: [build.log](https://github.com/cython/cython/files/4175243/build.log)

And here are the failures:

```
======================================================================
FAIL: A (always_allow_keywords_T295)
Doctest: always_allow_keywords_T295.A
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.9/doctest.py", line 2197, in runTest
    raise self.failureException(self.format_failure(new.getvalue()))

  File "/builddir/build/BUILD/cython-0.29.15/TEST_TMP/1/run/c/always_allow_keywords_T295/always_allow_keywords_T295.cpython-39-x86_64-linux-gnu.so", line unknown line number, in A
----------------------------------------------------------------------
File "/builddir/build/BUILD/cython-0.29.15/TEST_TMP/1/run/c/always_allow_keywords_T295/always_allow_keywords_T295.cpython-39-x86_64-linux-gnu.so", line ?, in always_allow_keywords_T295.A
Failed example:

      File "<doctest always_allow_keywords_T295.A[2]>", line 1, in <module>

    TypeError: A.meth1() takes no keyword arguments

comment_data.body: `always_allow_keywords_T295` looks to still be failing in the most recent master. The other tests all look to pass. `always_allow_keywords_T295` looks like a small change in the error strings rather than a real bug.
This seem to fix some of the classmethod issues: 1bb26b964060392ecb08c3b6c8ca4626e5c1eec7
I will try to backport these changes and see if that works.
They came from #3106.

Even with both  #3351 and #3106 backported, I still get tons of errors:
I can't really figure out what's going on here.

```

I tried the 0.29.17 release, but there are still errors:
logs: https://download.copr.fedorainfracloud.org/results/davidsch/python3.9/fedora-rawhide-x86_64/01354672-Cython/builder-live.log.gz

0.29.19 w/ 3.9.0b1 is even worse:

```
FAILED (failures=10, skipped=66)
```

[build.log](https://github.com/cython/cython/files/4680657/build.log)

I've added 3.9 to the `release` branch builds in travis, but allowed it to fail, e.g.
https://travis-ci.org/github/cython/cython/builds/689381624

So, yes, a few tests are failing. Help wanted to fix these issues. Cython 3.0 tests cleanly on the latest Py3.9. Backports should be limited, no features, only fixes. Cython 0.29.x is in maintenance and forwards-compatibility only mode.

Sadly, we're now hitting real failures in pandas due to this:

```
ImportError while loading conftest '/var/tmp/4/portage/dev-python/pandas-1.0.4/work/pandas-1.0.4-python3_9/lib/pandas/conftest.py'.
pandas/conftest.py:755: in <module>
    ("period", [pd.Period(2013), pd.NaT, pd.Period(2018)]),
pandas/_libs/tslibs/period.pyx:2475: in pandas._libs.tslibs.period.Period.__new__
    ???
pandas/_libs/tslibs/resolution.pyx:240: in pandas._libs.tslibs.resolution.Resolution.get_freq
    ???
E   AttributeError: type object 'type' has no attribute '_reso_freq_map'
```

This looks quite similar to the `classmethod.pyx` test failure. I've spent 3 hours trying to find a relevant commit with no luck. I've also tried to bisect master but I've reached irrelevant build failures before I rewinded it enough to get the test to fail.
(and pandas fail even worse with cython 3.x)
Good news, everyone! I did a second bisect attempt today, and this I've managed to find a fix: 1bb26b964060392ecb08c3b6c8ca4626e5c1eec7 apparently.
(sorry, pasted wrong commit id)
@mgorny that's a commit that we wanted to backport anyway (from #3106, see the discussion above).
Damn it, so much time wasted because I missed that tiny comment :-(.

Sorry for that. I picked it over to the 0.29.x branch now, to avoid even more duplicate work. Not sure if #3102 should also be backported. That would probably be more work, so I'll leave it out for now.

According to https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3349#issuecomment-597189353, there are more issue left after that. Those still need investigation.
I'm doing another test run, so if it finishes before Travis, I'll paste what still fails. However, this backport was sufficient to fix pandas for me.
Looks like I'll have to revert it since it makes the code fail in Py2.[67].
Maybe make the block conditional to py2?

I reverted the pick. You can wade your path through this, if you want. I'm not overly focussed on making 0.29.x work with Py3.9+ currently.

It seems that the relevant tests to run are selected by
`runtests.py -vv --backend=c --debug super function method static`

I've filed #3683 as a stop-gap solution. I think it's good enough as it fixes classmethods with py3.9 without (apparently) breaking anything that wasn't broken before. The staticmethods remain broken with py2 but that's not a regression, so I suppose we can live with it until someone figures out a better way.

> already fixed on master, but not in 0.29.20 nor in 3.0a5

I'll probably backport #3697 to 0.29.21 but wanted to wait until it a) works and b) received at least a bit of testing.
If you create a backport PR, I can give it some Fedora testing.

@hroncok could you test the latest `0.29.x` (or `release`) branch?

It contains a somewhat questionable change that makes it generate different code on 16-bit Py2.x Unicode platforms (including Windows), and hopefully only there – that's what I would like to be sure about.

The builds are here: https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/g/python/cython-0.29.x-tests/monitor/

I've built Cython without tests first and with tests enabled later. The tests-enabled build failed because of new numpy (I think).

I won't be able to investigate other failures any time now, sorry.

You can click the **failed** link in the right column to investigate a failure, than **builder-live.log.gz** on the bottom of the page.
There might be unrelated failures such as `nothing provides font(fontawesome) needed by python3-sphinx_rtd_theme-0.4.3-13.fc33.noarch` that we've just hit in Fedora.

Thanks @hroncok, that's very helpful. I've looked through the failures.

> The tests-enabled build failed because of new numpy (I think).

Yes, there is a bug in NumPy 1.19.0 that they'll probably fix in the next release. I had already disabled the NumPy installation of 1.19.0 as a test dependency, but if it's installed already, then the tests will still run. Those are the only test failures, though. I'll see if I can somehow disable the test itself for the specific NumPy version, but since it's a compile time failure, that's a bit tricky.

The other test failures do not seem "obviously related", so overall everything seems fine for a release.

> @hroncok, could you please rerun the Fedora builds with the latest branch? Thanks!

On it.
Builds running/pending in https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/g/python/cython-0.29.x-tests/monitor/
Maybe we can setup a CI that continuously (or daily) rebuilds the 0.29.x branch there and all the dependent packages. Let me know if you are interested.

Thank you. The errors look pretty much the same as before, and still seem unrelated.
Time for a new release.

title: Python 3.9 test failures on 0.29.x
